name: ListServiceAuditRecords
description:
Retrieve service audit records sorted by execution time.

Use this tool to get audit records for a specific service from PagerDuty, sorted by execution time from newest to oldest. Ideal for monitoring actions and changes related to a service. Ensure proper OAuth scope with `audit_records.read`.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The ID of the service for which audit records are being retrieved.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version to be accepted in the response headers, used for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the desired response format. The only accepted value is 'application/json'.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of audit records to return. Accepts an integer value.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Optional parameter to retrieve the next set of audit records. Use the token from `next_cursor` of the previous response. Defaults to the start if not provided.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start of the date range for search. Defaults to 24 hours ago if not specified.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for searching audit records. Defaults to `now()` if unspecified. Must be within 31 days after `start_date`.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.
